summary: This document is a preparation memo for the trial testimony of Larry Visoski (LV), a pilot for Jeffrey Epstein. It details his review of government exhibits (GX) depicting Epstein's properties and aircraft, and includes his observations about the relationship between Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Referred to as LV, he is being prepared for trial testimony. He reviewed government exhibits of Epstein's properties and aircraft and provided observations about Epstein and Maxwell's relationship.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as JE. The document details his various aircraft, properties, and his relationship with Ghislaine Maxwell as observed by his pilot.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as GM. The pilot, Larry Visoski, clarifies that he could tell Epstein and Maxwell were in a personal relationship in the 1990s based on their interactions and travel planning.

persons.name: McGorty
persons.context: Listed among the attorneys (AUSA SA Attorneys) present for the VTC prep session with Larry Visoski.

persons.name: Giffuni
persons.context: Listed among the attorneys (AUSA SA Attorneys) present for the VTC prep session with Larry Visoski.

persons.name: Zelenko
persons.context: Listed among the attorneys (AUSA SA Attorneys) present for the VTC prep session with Larry Visoski.

connections.description: Larry Visoski observed they were in a personal relationship in the 1990s based on how they interacted and made travel plans together. This changed in the early 2000s when Maxwell acted more as support to Epstein.
Visoski is Epstein's pilot, responsible for flying his various aircraft and familiar with his properties and travel patterns.

events.title: VTC Prep for Trial Testimony
events.description: Larry Visoski participates in a video teleconference (VTC) preparation session with attorneys (McGorty, Giffuni, Zelenko) to review government exhibits for upcoming trial testimony.

events.title: Passenger on Epstein's Plane
events.description: Larry Visoski confirms that a passenger named on document GX-12 flew on Jeffrey Epstein's plane in the mid-1990s.

locations: Zorro Ranch, New Mexico (main house and entrance)
Little St. James Island (main housing complex)
Palm Beach house (JE garage and pool)
keyFacts: Larry Visoski, Epstein's pilot, identified numerous government exhibits depicting Epstein's aircraft (Boeing 727, Hawker, Gulfstream G2B, helicopter) and properties in New York, New Mexico, the Virgin Islands, Paris, and Palm Beach.
Visoski testified that he could tell Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell were in a personal relationship in the 1990s based on their interactions and joint travel planning.
Visoski noted a shift in the early 2000s where Maxwell's role changed from a partner in planning to acting as support staff for Epstein's travel desires.
The document is a preparation memo for trial testimony, indicating active legal proceedings related to Epstein in 2011.
